content.description:
From a ledge, clip a bolt, and step right on techy face holds. Climb up and right to a tips crack that widens as you climb, and follow it to the top (the top flake is a bit thin and hollow, so placing gear in the adjacent crack to the left is a great option).

-Watch out for a loose rock at the top, it's easy to avoid (it would be easy to clean).
content.protection: A single rack with doubles of 0.75-2" could be useful.
content.location: On the far right side of the crag, there is a bolt at the start of it.

content.description: Climb a left-facing corner to an overhang. Here, step left to thin holds (crux) to gain the next crack, and follow it to the top.
content.location: It is on the far left side of the wall.

content.description: Climb a huge, detached block to gain an obvious, left-facing corner. Climb this to the top.
content.protection: A single rack to 4" (with maybe a few extra finger-size pieces).
content.location: It ascends a big, left-facing corner in center of the wall.
